meanings.definition: In a unique or exceptional manner
meanings.sent1: She sang singularly beautifully at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work is singularly impressive.
meanings.sent3: The cat singularly danced on its hind legs.
meanings.sent4: His kindness shone singularly in a world of indifference.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak stood singularly against the sky.

meanings.sent1: He was singularly focused on his studies.
meanings.sent2: The decision was singularly his to make.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel singularly hoarded all the nuts in the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were singularly occupied by the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The key to success lies singularly in hard work.

meanings.definition: Distinguished by being the only one of its kind
meanings.sent1: The singularly beautiful flower bloomed in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The singularly rare coin was a prized possession.
meanings.sent3: The singularly tall giraffe reached for the leaves on the tree.
meanings.sent4: His singularly unique style set him apart from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The singularly bright star guided them through the night.
